RECORD.TEXT: 419144560 YC 85715544 491476 9/24/2001 12:00:00 AM PREGNANCY , INDUCED , HYPERTENSION Signed DIS Admission Date : 09/24/2001 Report Status : Signed Discharge Date : 10/03/2001 FINAL DIAGNOSES : 1. INTRAUTERINE PREGNANCY AT 29 5/7 WEEKS . 2. INTRAUTERINE INSEMINATION TRIPLETS . 3. MILD PREECLAMPSIA . 4. STATUS POST CESAREAN SECTION . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : The patient is a 36 year-old gravida 4 , para 0 , at 29 5/7 weeks on 9/24/01 with intrauterine insemination tri / tri triplets who was admitted for rule out preeclampsia . The dating from last menstrual period was confirmed by 6.3 week ultrasound . Prenatal screen : A+ , rubella immune . The patient was noted to have a cervix that was shortening on ultrasound on 7/2/01 . It was close to greater than 3 cm and , on 7/9/01 , it was 2.3 cm with funneling . At that point a Shirodkar cerclage was placed on 7/9/01 at 18 weeks with a posterior knot . Her pregnancy was otherwise uncomplicated and she was continued to be followed with serial ultrasounds . For her preeclampsia her booking blood pressure was 120/80 at 11 5/7 weeks and , during her prenatal course , her blood pressure ran from 110 to 140s/70s. On 9/24/01 in the office her blood pressure was 152/78 and she was sent to triage for further evaluation . In triage she denied any headaches , blurry vision , right upper quadrant tenderness , or increase in upper extremity or facial edema . She denied any contractions or leakage of fluid or bleeding per vagina and she noted good fetal movement . PAST OB HISTORY : In 1991 , spontaneous abortion . In 2000 , spontaneous abortion . In 1992 , at 26 weeks she presented at 4 cm dilatation and had vaginal delivery of spontaneous twins of 2 pounds 0 ounces and 2 pounds 1 ounce ; the second twin passed away after 13 days . There is a question of an abruption and a workup was negative in March of 2000 . PAST GYN HISTORY : Abnormal pap smear times one and then normal since . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : None . PAST SURGICAL HISTORY : Dilatation and evacuation for spontaneous abortion . MEDICATIONS : Prenatal vitamins . ALLERGIES : No known drug allergies . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : VITAL SIGNS : Blood pressure 160/80 sitting . ABDOMEN : Soft , nontender , gravid . EXTREMITIES : 2+ pitting edema . PELVIC : On tocometer , she had no contractions . Her fetal heart rates were in the 120s to 140s with good variability and reactive for twin # 3 . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was admitted for rule out preeclampsia . She had no signs or symptoms of preeclampsia . Her laboratory values were within normal limits except for uric acid that was 9.2 on admission . Subsequently her uric acid continued to increase to 10.2 and a 24-hour urine on 9/25/01 revealed 2,518 mg. Her blood pressure always remained in the mild range and she never was diagnosed with severe preeclampsia . During this admission she received Betamethasone and was Betamethasone complete on 9/26/01 . Her group B strep was negative on 9/24/01 . On 9/25/01 infant # 1 was 1,393 gm at 63rd percentile ; infant # 2 was 1,539 gm at 80th percentile ; infant # 3 was 1,237 gm in the 4th percentile- all with normal fluids and biophysical profiles that were 8/8 . On 9/29/01 she spontaneously ruptured her membranes . She was confirmed ruptured by positive pool , fern , and Nitrazine . An ultrasound revealed that the presenting twin was breech and # 2 was vertex , as well as # 3 . Given that she had triplets at this presentation and had been ruptured and subsequently began contracting , going into preterm labor with a cervix that was 4 to 5 cm dilated and 100% effaced , the decision was made to proceed to cesarean section for delivery . On 9/29/01 she underwent a primary low transverse cesarean section via Pfannenstiel skin incision delivering three viable infants . The surgery was otherwise uncomplicated and her estimated blood loss was approximately 1,200 cc . In her postoperative course she was doing well . She received 24 hours of magnesium without any signs of toxicity . Repeat laboratory values showed improvement in her laboratory data , especially with a decline in her uric acid . Her blood pressures on postoperative day # 0 were 160s to 170s/70s to 80s and , given her elevated systolic pressure , she was started on Labetolol 100 mg b.i.d. Her blood pressures ranged between 140s and 160s/70s to 80s and she remained without any symptoms of preeclampsia . Given that she was in stable condition , ambulating , voiding , tolerating food , and passing flatus by postoperative day # 4 , she was discharged to home . DISPOSITION : FOLLOWUP : Followup with primary obstetrician within one week for blood pressure check . DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS : Labetolol 100 mg b.i.d. , Colace , Motrin , and Percocet .
